history.content:
1. Ramchandran and Rao are amazing, Lanzara is good for physics so I've heard. Other people may be able to add more to this list. 

2. It's a lot. If you're concerned with getting to EECS upper divs, I would say 7B would be the one to drop. Your mileage may vary.

3. No, they are fine to take concurrently. 

- - - 

1) Prof Maharbiz is great for the circuits portion of EE16B

1. Ramchandran and Rao are amazing, Lanzara is good for physics so I've heard. Other people may be able to add more to this list. 

2. It's a lot. If you're concerned with getting to EECS upper divs, I would say 7B would be the one to drop. Your mileage may vary.

3. No, they are fine to take concurrently.

Professors for Fall 2017:

CS61C: Krste Asanovic, Randy Katz

CS70: Kannan Ramchandran, Satish Rao

EE16B: Arda Ege Sahiner, Jessie Yang, Michael Lustig, Michel Maharbiz

Physics 7B: Robert J. Birgeneau OR  ALESSANDRA LANZARA

Sophomore EECS major with intended minor in Math (maybe?). I had some questions on the given schedule. 

1) How are the professors for the following classes? If there are better professors, should I postpone one of these classes to the spring (CS70, CS61C, or Physics 7B)?

2) How is the workload for the schedule? If the workload is too much, which of the following technicals should I drop? If it's not, I wanted to add Math 110 to the setup to get that out of the way.

3) Is there a better order to take these classes? e.g. should I wait to take 61C after 70.

Thanks in advance, any and all input is appreciated. <3
history.subject: CS61C, CS70, EE16B, Physics 7B, Upper Division Humanities
